New Records: Liam Livingstone scored his first ODI century in a 140-run partnership with Sam Curran
Key Match Events: Phil Salt's 59 and Jacob Bethell's maiden half-century gave England a solid beginning
Liam Livingstone's 124 not out from 85 deliveries led England to a five-wicket win
Shai Hope made 117 to lead West Indies to 328-6
Post-Match Reflections: Liam Livingstone said he felt he was getting back to his best and was just maturing a little bit, knowing his game pretty well and just enjoying cricket which he knows is the main thing
Miscellaneous Highlights: England finished its successful run chase on 329-5 in the second one-day international with 15 balls remaining
Young fast bowler John Turner had West Indies in trouble at 12-2
West Indies' late charge brought 93 runs from the last 10 overs
Others: The third and deciding match of the series will be played at Bridgetown, Barbados, on Wednesday
